Pay10 becomes first entity to go live on CBUAE's open finance frameworkThe new license gives Pay10 secure, real-time access to consumer bank accounts, enabling seamless third-party financial services. This sets the foundation for broader innovations in areas such as embedded finance, digital identity, and interoperable payment systems.

India hits pause on Indus Waters Treaty: Could this dry up Pakistan's economy?India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty (IWT). The announcement was made by Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri on Wednesday, a day after a deadly attack in Pahalgam killed several civilians.

Gold vs mutual funds: What should you invest in for better returns?Gold is often seen as a safe investment. When markets are shaky or inflation rises, many investors turn to gold. On the other hand, mutual funds, particularly equity funds, are linked to the stock market. When the market does well, your mutual fund investment can grow faster.

Aamir Khan was in 'no state' to attend Andaz Apna… re-release amid Pahalgam tragedyA special screening of the 1994 classic 'Andaz Apna Apna' was held earlier this week. However, Aamir Khan opted out of attending as he was deeply shaken by the recent terror attack in Pahalgam.

Actors Ajith Kumar, Shalini celebrate 25 years of togetherness in cute video. WatchActors Ajith Kumar and Shalini rang in their 25th wedding anniversary in a quiet celebration. Shalini shared a cute video in which they are feeding each other chocolate cake.

Billy Ray Cyrus confirms romance with Elizabeth Hurley after surprise textBilly Ray Cyrus confirms a new romance with Elizabeth Hurley, sparked by a heartfelt text. Reconnecting after two years, the pair's bond has brought him happiness and healing following a difficult divorce.

Netflix suffers global outage: Millions face log-in errors and profile glitchesNetflix experienced a major global outage, affecting millions of users with login errors, profile mismatches, and streaming disruptions. She also prayed for the nation to stand united.

Dear Mr Murtaza…: India writes to Pak, notifies Indus Waters Treaty pauseIn a letter to Pakistan, India said that Islamabad had breached the Indus Waters Treaty conditions by sustained cross-border terrorism targetting Jammu and Kashmir.

Live: Key meet on Indus Waters Treaty at Amit Shah's residence todayPahalgam terror attack live updates: A crucial meeting on the Indus Water Treaty issue will be held today at the residence of Home Minister Amit Shah. Several Union Ministers, including Jal Shakti Minister CR Patil, are expected to attend the meeting. On Tuesday, 26 people were killed in a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam. Following the attack, India took a series of sweeping diplomatic and strategic countermeasures against Pakistan, including the effective downgrading of diplomatic relations with Pakistan, closure of key border routes, suspension of the Indus Waters Treaty, and the expulsion of Pakistani military attaches from its High Commission in New Delhi. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Pakistan's role is undeniable, and India has both diplomatic and kinetic options on the table, like after the Uri and Pulwama attacks. This is why Pakistan's army chief, General Asim Munir, might be risking a limited war with India.
